techniques.name: X-ray diffraction
techniques.parameters: cubic spinel structure with Fd3hm space group

challenge.description: Difficulty in synthesizing high-quality single crystals of spinel-type LiMn2O4.
challenge.impact: The lack of high-quality single crystals hinders precise structural investigations and understanding of the material's properties.

solution.description: A flux growth method was employed using a mixture of LiMn2O4 powder and lithium chloride in a sealed gold tube, heated at 1173 K for 10 days and gradually cooled to 297 K.
solution.methodology: Flux growth method with controlled heating and cooling in a sealed gold tube.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully produced black, octahedral-shaped single crystals of about 0.05 × 0.05 × 0.05 mm³, free from gold contamination as confirmed by SEM-EDX analysis.

evidence.data: SEM-EDX analysis confirmed the absence of gold contamination, and the crystals were characterized as stoichiometric LiMn2O4 by ICP spectroscopy.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with cubic symmetry and stoichiometric composition.
context.experimental_conditions: Heating at 1173 K for 10 days, followed by gradual cooling to 297 K at a rate of 5 K/h.
context.application_relevance: High-quality single crystals are essential for precise structural studies and understanding the material's phase transitions and physical properties.

challenge.description: Presence of twinning in the orthorhombic phase at low temperatures.
challenge.impact: Twinning complicates the determination of the crystal structure and lattice parameters, affecting the accuracy of structural analysis.

solution.description: The twinning domain ratio was estimated using integrated intensity ratios, and the twin matrix was determined to account for the structural complexity.
solution.methodology: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction mapping and analysis of integrated intensity ratios.
solution.effectiveness: Enabled estimation of the twinning domain ratio (10:2:3) and determination of the twin matrix, facilitating further structural analysis.

evidence.data: Reciprocal space mapping at 230 K showed three peaks corresponding to twinning components, with a domain ratio of 10:2:3.

context.material_properties: Orthorhombic symmetry at low temperatures with twinning components.
context.experimental_conditions: Characterization performed at 230 K using single-crystal X-ray diffraction.
context.application_relevance: Understanding twinning is crucial for accurate modeling of the material's low-temperature structural properties.
